commitResults.messageTitle: [#2273] Update workflows to use v4 of artifact actions (#2274)
commitResults.messageBody:
Upgrade artifact actions to v4

All workflows using v3 of artifact actions automatically fail from
2025-01-30 onwards due to deprecation.

Let's upgrade to the latest version (v4).

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2266] Fix Cypress tests that fail locally (#2272)
commitResults.messageBody:
Set UTC timezone for test reports

Running Cypress tests locally uses system's default timezone
(UTC+8), causing 3 tests that check for dates to fail. These 3 tests
pass on GitHub Actions as the system's default timezone is UTC.

Let's standardize the timezone for all cypress tests to UTC.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2275] Upgrade node to v20 in workflows (#2282)
commitResults.messageBody:
Upgrade node to v20

Node 18 will reach end-of-life on 30 April 2025.

Let's upgrade node to v20.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2304] Portfolio flag to support optimised portfolio report (#2310)
commitResults.messageBody:
Add portfolio CLI flag

We are currently adding support for reports optimized for code
portfolio pages.

Let's add a boolean flag in the backend to indicate whether to generate
the optimized portfolio report in the generated summary.json.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2259] Upgrade GitHub Actions macOS runners to 13, 14 and 15 (#2260)
commitResults.messageBody:
Update GitHub Action runner to macOS 13, 14, 15 and remove macOS 12

The macOS 12 version is deprecated and removed by the end of 2024.
This commit updates the GitHub Action runner to use macOS 13, 14,
and 15 instead.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2252] Add ubuntu-24.04 to CI runners (#2261)
commitResults.messageBody:
Add ubuntu-24.04 to CI runners

This PR updates the CI configuration to include Ubuntu 24.04 as one 
of the runners. This ensures that our code is tested on the latest
Ubuntu version, providing better compatibility and early detection
of potential issues.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1955] Usage of directive shorthand syntax in .vue files (#2290)
commitResults.messageBody:
Use directive shorthands in .vue files

This refactor removes explicit Vue directives and replaces them with
shorthand syntax, following Vue's Style Guide practices to improve
readability and reduce verbosity.

Changes include:
- Using `:` instead of `v-bind:`
- Using `@` instead of `v-on:`
- Using `#` instead of `v-slot`

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2224] Update GitHub workflow to avoid deprecation warnings (#2298)
commitResults.messageBody:
Update GitHub workflow to avoid deprecation warnings

Updated actions/checkout@v3 to v4 using Node 20.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2265][#2267]Fix outdated suggested solution for backend Task 1 (#2268)
commitResults.messageBody:
* Update suggested solution for backend task 1 hint 3

* Remove error

* Update suggested solution for backend task 1 hint 2

---------

Co-authored-by: Ryan Poon <96387349+sopa301@users.noreply.github.com>

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2213] Fix hr element not appearing in report (#2279)
commitResults.messageBody:
Fix the <hr> element not appearing in report

The <hr> element in title.md and blurbs.md is not appearing in the
report because the normalise.css defaults the <hr> element style.

Let's override the <hr> element style in style.scss so that it will
appear in the report.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1941] Remove test mode flag (#2314)
commitResults.messageBody:
Remove test mode flag

Currently, the test mode flag is not utilised in our codebase. The test
mode flag was added to pass system tests due to legacy reasons and the
related logic was removed in a previous PR.

Let's remove the related code and documentation for the test mode flag
to avoid additional maintenance.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2277] Fix cypress setting up error (#2278)
commitResults.messageBody: Update apt package

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2269] Update codecov version (#2271)
commitResults.messageBody:
Update codecov version

The depreciation of older version of codecov script causes token-less
upload of coverage report fail.

Let's update the codecov action to the latest version.

---------

Co-authored-by: CHENYIXUN <guest1@CHENYIXUN>

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2262] Update type adapter adding methods for gson builder (#2270)
commitResults.messageBody:
Update GSON type adapter adding methods

The registration of custom adapters for ZoneID and LocalDateTime causes
The JsonIOException to pop up when trying to run the jar file in java
17.

Let's use the registerTypeHierarchyAdapter method to add the custom
adapters instead.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2258] Update user guide for Netlify deployment (#2294)
commitResults.messageBody:
Update Netlify build script

* Update the Netlify appendix method will not be supported going
forward.
* Update this page to recommend Github Actions instead of Netlify
* Change other references as needed.

Let's update relevant part of UG.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2280] Specify time periods for different repos in csv config (#2281)
commitResults.messageBody:
Specify time periods for different repos in csv config

This is to address the request to allow different periods for different
repos. 

Let's update the methods of parsing csv file and updating analysis
dates of repo configuration in the backend.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2292] Fix surge.sh preview failure on PR (#2293)
commitResults.messageBody:
Set allow_forks flag to true

The publish to surge.sh fails because of the failure in downloading
artifacts. This appears to be caused by the fact that default value
of allow_forks is false

Let's manually set allow_forks to true

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2190] Add ESLint rule to enforce commas between types (#2287)
commitResults.messageBody:
Add ESLint rule to enforce commas between types

This PR overrides the default behavior of requiring semicolon
separators for both interface and type in ESLint, to require semicolon
separator for interface and comma separator for type

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1952] Add description to Gradle tasks (#2288)
commitResults.messageBody: Add description to Gradle tasks for better readability

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2327] Upgrade Vite version to 6.2.2 (#2328)
commitResults.messageBody:
Upgrade Vite version to 6.2.2

To address 4 moderate vulnerability issues in npm.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2333] Add Renovate (#2335)
commitResults.messageBody:
Add Renovate to automate package upgrades

Let's add Renovate to further automate our dependency update process.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2326] Optimize Vite Chunk Size (#2325)
commitResults.messageBody:
Optimize Vite Chunk Size

Did the following optimizations to reduce max chunk size from ~1.5MB to
~0.8MB. 

Manually split the Vue libraries and large utility libraries into
their own chunks. This reduces the max chunk size since we now have 3
main files instead of having everything in the index file as one large
chunk.

Also set the chunkSizeWarningLimit to 1000 for now, since the
highligh.js package is already 862.99kB on its own.

Note:
Command to generate the breakdown of chunk sizes:  
npx vite-bundle-visualizer -t sunburst

commitResults.messageTitle: [#2332] Frontend Sort Function Bugfix and Enhancement (#2337)
commitResults.messageBody:
Frontend Sort Function Enhancement

Improve frontend sort function efficiency for descending order by
refactoring to use boolean, and modify the sort comparator to take in 1
additional argument `isDesc` instead of calling `.reverse()` after
doing an ascending sort.


Important: A Cypress test case was modified to account for corrected
behavior because previous code for 'groupByAuthors' contains a bug
where we use `sortingWithinOption` instead of `sortWithinOption`, thus
causing the sort order within a group to be arbitrary if we sort by
'title' 
since the property doesn't exist and we are sorting an array of blank
strings.
